meanings.definition: To surpass in skill or cunning
meanings.sent1: She outdodges her opponents in every game they play.
meanings.sent2: He always outdodges his classmates in solving puzzles.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outdodges the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outdodges any obstacles that come her way.
meanings.sent5: The skilled magician outdodges the audience's expectations with every trick.

meanings.sent1: The detective outdodges the criminal in a thrilling chase.
meanings.sent2: She easily outdodges her opponents in the chess tournament.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon outdodges the guard to steal some snacks.
meanings.sent4: His strategic planning outdodges any attempts to sabotage his project.
meanings.sent5: The clever cat outdodges the dog in a playful game of tag.

meanings.definition: To avoid or evade something by cleverness or skill
meanings.sent1: He outdodges the rain by carrying an umbrella wherever he goes.
meanings.sent2: She outdodges awkward situations by changing the topic smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The crafty squirrel outdodges the falling acorns by jumping from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: The agile gymnast outdodges any mistakes during her routine.
meanings.sent5: The quick thinker outdodges any potential dangers with ease.
